DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Maternal HLA Typing Availability Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the umbilical cord blood maternal HLA typing is available.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Maternal HLA Typing Availability
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._Having to do with the mother, coming from the mother, or related through the mother._A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Maternal HLA Typing
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:A designation that has some relationship to motherhood.:A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
A designation that has some relationship to motherhood.
A process in which blood or tissue samples are analyzed to determine their human leukocyte antigen (HLA) profiles.

Property.preferredDefinition: Available; obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
